['', 'Communicate directly with industry and academic partners to manage development needs on joint collaborations and custom projects', 'Software Validation (woah, you might actually get the chance to ask the users what they like/dislike about your software)', 'Our Quality team, this group will help you document your work in all the ways required for medical software.', 'Preferred: Familiarity with medical device software development standards (IEC 62304, ISO 13485, etc.)', 'Do you like problem solving? Not, can-you-make-my-product-look-like-apple-designed-it kind of problem solving, but real-time neural signal decoding, how-do-we-keep-up-with-the-most-exciting-emerging-field-in-biotech, how-do-we-make-really-complex-data-easy-to-understand-kind-of-problem-solving.\xa0', 'Preferred: MATLAB, MEX, and Python 3 experience', 'Are you into it? Does this job posting make you warm and fuzzy inside? Are you already on our website checking out our products to see what you can do to make them even better?\xa0', 'Have opportunities for skillset growth and increasing technical knowledge', 'If you answered yes to these questions, you may have met your match!', 'Here’s what we are looking for. If you’ve got some or all of these under your belt, then you’ve got the chops:', '\xa0Do you like the idea of contributing to an engineering team that has their hearts (and minds and hands) set on radically improving the lives of high-need patients?', 'We are looking for a skilled, hard-working, driven Software Engineer to join our tight-knit team of experienced professionals to help develop software used to read and write the human nervous system. This is a full-time, salaried position, starting immediately in our Salt Lake City office.\xa0This position reports to our Dungeons and Dragons-fanatic, fine-whisky-drinking, Lead Software Engineer, Robert Roundy.', 'Low-level sockets programming for high-bandwidth network communication', 'Required: 5-10 years of C++ experience (MUST BE C++… seriously, we need a C++ wizard)', 'Ripplers are given high-level tasks and a bit of context. Then, they are expected to seek out information, standards, develop new skills and design something great with a team of similarly dedicated and driven colleagues.', 'Then what are you waiting for? Send your resume on over to\xa0jobs@rppl.com', 'Collaborate with electrical and mechanical engineering teams within Ripple during product development lifecycle to ensure successful design specification and project execution', 'Modern language standards (C++11 or later)', 'Develop new software (in C++) for Ripple hardware devices', 'Robert and the Software Team including Alireza, Jay, and Greg. You will report all of your successes (and rare but occasional failures) to Rob. This team works in a conducive, collaborative environment where you will feel welcome to share ideas and must be open to receiving feedback.', 'Our Electrical and Mechanical Engineering teams. You will work them during product development lifecycle to ensure successful design specification and project execution These guys are super smart and always willing to come up with the best solution. They may even invite you on their Monday Del Taco runs!', 'What do you think?', 'Ripple is committed to equal employment opportunities, and does not discriminate on the basis of any protected class defined by the Equal Employment Opportunity laws.\xa0Yeah, I know. You’ve heard it a million times, but we really do mean it. We view diversity as an opportunity and strength. We are totally willing to make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform this job.\xa0', 'Non-negotiable: Demonstrable ability to solve complex problems', 'Want to work with the coolest gang of engineers ever? Yeah, that’s right. We think engineers are pretty cool around here. You can talk through ideas in the office or you can grab some Banh Mi’s and discuss the next project.\xa0', 'Software Verification (basically CI for medical software)', 'At Ripple, team members are often asked to do things they have never done before. We expect a lot of chances to hear differing opinions, and to be surrounded by people who deeply care about our projects and are interested in the big picture of what Ripple is trying to accomplish. Ripplers are encouraged to take time to help and teach others, and to listen, learn and change\xa0their own views until a solution emerges.\xa0\xa0', 'Develop new software (in C++) for Ripple hardware devicesMaintain and improve existing software for Ripple’s current product lineCollaborate with electrical and mechanical engineering teams within Ripple during product development lifecycle to ensure successful design specification and project executionCommunicate directly with industry and academic partners to manage development needs on joint collaborations and custom projectsLearn about neuroscience and Brain Machine InterfacesDocumentation – we are in the process of becoming ISO 13485 compliant; this means we will be a certified medical device company.Software Verification (basically CI for medical software)Software Validation (woah, you might actually get the chance to ask the users what they like/dislike about your software)Be thoughtfully constructive:\xa0We are looking for solution-oriented team players who can check their egos in order to collaborate to overcome obstacles.Have opportunities for skillset growth and increasing technical knowledge', 'We are excited to hear from you!', 'Here’s what you’ll do:', 'Required: Unit and integration testing experience', 'Maintain and improve existing software for Ripple’s current product line', 'Required: Experience with electronic testing equipment (scopes, signal generators, etc.)', 'At its core,\xa0Ripple is a community of driven people who are choosing to work together on really hard problems. We are builders and creators and want to see our efforts impact the world for\xa0good. Those who thrive at Ripple are self-motivated and work well independently. There are times of intense effort and individual contribution and sacrifice, but we know that what we are building will take time, and living a fulfilling life outside of Ripple will keep team members deeply engaged.\xa0\xa0', 'Be thoughtfully constructive:\xa0We are looking for solution-oriented team players who can check their egos in order to collaborate to overcome obstacles.', 'Threading constructs and multi-threaded application development', 'Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. We are a team. We pitch in and help each other on all projects if it means it will help us reach our mission. If you are “above” doing certain tasks, Ripple is definitely not a good fit for you.\xa0', 'with a cover letter explaining your interest in this position, and in working for Ripple.', 'Ripple creates life enhancing neurotechnology for research and medical applications. Our\xa0products integrate cutting-edge hardware and software elements designed to read and write from the human nervous system. We are funded by our sales revenue and grants from NIH, DARPA, and the Congressionally Directed Medical Research Program (*sigh* that was a mouthful.)', 'We expect great ideas to come from everyone at Ripple. We are passionate and friendly, patient and thoughtful, and all agree to not work with jackasses (no matter how great you think you are). All of us must actively contribute to the quality of our processes and products through thoughtful effort. There is no shortcut to making implantable medical devices or cutting-edge neuroscience tools, but with a strong team of friends building them together, it is worth it.', 'Here’s who you’ll do it with:\xa0', 'Documentation – we are in the process of becoming ISO 13485 compliant; this means we will be a certified medical device company.', 'Learn about neuroscience and Brain Machine Interfaces', 'About this Position', 'OS level programming (Linux, OSX, or Windows)', 'About Ripple', 'Required: 5-10 years of C++ experience (MUST BE C++… seriously, we need a C++ wizard)Modern language standards (C++11 or later)OS level programming (Linux, OSX, or Windows)Low-level sockets programming for high-bandwidth network communicationThreading constructs and multi-threaded application developmentRequired: Experience with electronic testing equipment (scopes, signal generators, etc.)Required: Unit and integration testing experiencePreferred: Familiarity with medical device software development standards (IEC 62304, ISO 13485, etc.)Preferred: MATLAB, MEX, and Python 3 experienceNon-negotiable: Demonstrable ability to solve complex problems', 'Does writing code used to make a lifechanging device that could survive in the human body sound awesome to you? What about Neuroscience? Do you want to be a part of the global effort to create the first widespread computer link to the brain (and beat Elon Musk to the punch)?\xa0', 'Robert and the Software Team including Alireza, Jay, and Greg. You will report all of your successes (and rare but occasional failures) to Rob. This team works in a conducive, collaborative environment where you will feel welcome to share ideas and must be open to receiving feedback.Our Electrical and Mechanical Engineering teams. You will work them during product development lifecycle to ensure successful design specification and project execution These guys are super smart and always willing to come up with the best solution. They may even invite you on their Monday Del Taco runs!Our Quality team, this group will help you document your work in all the ways required for medical software.']

['\xa0 ', '', 'Intelliswift Software is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.', 'Specific \xa0 \xa0 • Receive and Categorize inventory daily using predefined processes and procedures. • Inventory hardware devices with attention to detail and conformance with internal systems. • Rack and document hardware installation within the datacenter using predefined processes and tools. • Execute Device lifecycle management control using predefined processes and procedures. • Cable and document connections between devices. • Assign Static IP configurations for device setup and installation. • Cable and confirm power on status for storage devices • Moderate Connectivity IP Troubleshooting ', 'Required Skills: Data Center Operations, Racking, Stacking, IP configurations ', 'Job Description: ', ' ']

['', 'Write test-driven development code', 'Ciitizen has assembled an all-star team, led by its CEO, Anil Sethi (last company was sold to Apple) and is backed by a strong investment team led by Andreessen Horowitz, Verily and others.   ', 'Bonus Points:', 'Minimum 5 years experience as a front end software engineer or design engineer', 'Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done', 'Responsibilities:', 'On a mission to revolutionize healthcareCulture of doersVenture backed, Series A equityGenerous Benefits, Discretionary Time Off', 'Implement front-end features according to specifications', 'Culture of doers', 'A firm grasp of fundamentals including object oriented design, data structures, algorithm design,\xa0 and knowledge of the latest development trends from mobile web, including responsive design, accessibility, and site performance', 'On a mission to revolutionize healthcare', 'Requirements:', 'Must be a doer', 'Expert understanding of modern CSS, Javascript, and HTML', 'Nimble and iterative approach', 'All patients have a right to all of their health information, yet existing portals pull only minimal clinical information from a fraction of health care institutions. Current “interoperability” initiatives leave the patient out of the picture and often rely on armies of manual labor to extract key health insights from unstructured textual data—an expensive model which doesn’t scale.', 'Venture backed, Series A equity', 'In the near future, citizens will walk into a clinical facility and, with a simple tap of a mobile device, release their health information to themselves, where Ciitizen normalizes unstructured data from across the healthcare ecosystem into actionable visualizations for patients, their caregivers, and clinicians.', 'Generous Benefits, Discretionary Time Off', 'Perks:', 'Nimble and iterative approachStrong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job doneSkills: JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, Angular, Node.js, React, Backbone.js, Kubernetes\xa0Working knowledge of cross platform/browser compatibility issues (Edge, Firefox, Safari, Chrome)Familiarity with web test automation tools such as Selenium, Appium, WebdriverIO, etc', 'About Us:', 'Familiarity with web test automation tools such as Selenium, Appium, WebdriverIO, etc', 'Meet mandated deadlines', 'The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced start-up environment (including dealing with ambiguity), be self-driven, and possess high integrity and accountability', 'Ciitizen’s mission is to provide Earth’s 7.3 billion citizens with control of their complete health information and give them the choice of sharing it with whomever they want. Period. With this new ownership, patients can share their health history with caregivers, share for second opinions, and with companies/researchers who may hold the answer to their treatment.', 'Skills: JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, Angular, Node.js, React, Backbone.js, Kubernetes\xa0', 'Ciitizen, the leading health data innovation company, is looking for a Front End Engineer to help us transform our amazing technology into a great service.\xa0 Working directly with the CEO and our dynamic team, the Front End Engineer will help shape the future of healthcare by developing a mobile-web-first app, with emphasis from Material Design and leanings towards minimalism through “Less, but better”.\xa0 The role is based out of the Ciitizen offices in Palo Alto, California but can be 100% remote.\xa0', 'Working knowledge of cross platform/browser compatibility issues (Edge, Firefox, Safari, Chrome)', 'Implement front-end features according to specificationsWrite test-driven development codeMeet mandated deadlinesWork directly with the CEO and provide status to the company regularly', 'Work directly with the CEO and provide status to the company regularly', 'The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced start-up environment (including dealing with ambiguity), be self-driven, and possess high integrity and accountabilityMinimum 5 years experience as a front end software engineer or design engineerExpert understanding of modern CSS, Javascript, and HTMLA firm grasp of fundamentals including object oriented design, data structures, algorithm design,\xa0 and knowledge of the latest development trends from mobile web, including responsive design, accessibility, and site performanceMust be a doer']

['', '          o Software Risk Classification\xa0', 'Responsibilities:', "As a Software Engineer – Medical Device, you will help plan processes and requirements with internal customers and work hand-in-hand with your development engineering counterparts to ensure compliance with Risk Management / Design Control procedures and create the necessary documents necessary for a comprehensive Design History File. It's your job to ensure the outputs of each phase of the design and development process are adequately planned, executed and documented in compliance with internal procedures and that a complete, compliant Risk Management strategy has been fully implemented and documented. The incumbent in this position must have detailed working knowledge of common Design Control and Risk Management models including ISO 14971,13485 and the FDA’s Quality System Regulation.", 'Have direct responsibility for execution and corresponding documentation for the following elements of the design control and risk management processes:\xa0', 'Develop and implement risk acceptability criteria as a part of the Risk Management Process.\xa0', '\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Synergis is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer', 'Provide for ongoing review of design control activities to ensure that all procedures guiding the processes and outputs of these processes meet applicable regulations and standards.\xa0Propose, review and approve proposed changes to design control and software management policies and procedures that are a part of the Company’s Quality Management System\xa0Participate as a peer with design and development engineers on complex technical topics to ensure design solutions are compliant with company procedures, adequately mitigate safety risks, and are likely to be acceptable to regulatory product reviewers (if applicable).\xa0Develop and implement risk acceptability criteria as a part of the Risk Management Process.\xa0', '5+ years’ of software design assurance or quality engineering experience in the medical device industry including direct experience with software regulated as a medical device in the United States and European markets.', 'Location: REMOTE', 'Requirements:', 'Provide for ongoing review of design control activities to ensure that all procedures guiding the processes and outputs of these processes meet applicable regulations and standards.\xa0', 'Synergis (', 'Bachelor’s degree in engineering, technology or science related field. Preferred degrees include BSCS, BSCE, BSBE5+ years’ of software design assurance or quality engineering experience in the medical device industry including direct experience with software regulated as a medical device in the United States and European markets.5+ years’ of experience in performing Risk Management activities under ISO 14971 or equivalent risk management frameworks. This must include hands-on experience performing Hazards Analysis, FTA, DFMEA and UFMEA.Significant experience in developing software engineering documents as components of a Design History File including; Design and Development Plans, Design Inputs and Outputs, Verification and Validation protocols and reports, Design Transfer Plans, Design Review Minutes, Risk Management Plans, Risk Analyses.', '5+ years’ of experience in performing Risk Management activities under ISO 14971 or equivalent risk management frameworks. This must include hands-on experience performing Hazards Analysis, FTA, DFMEA and UFMEA.', 'Type of Position: W2 contract, anticipated 6+month contract', 'Bachelor’s degree in engineering, technology or science related field. Preferred degrees include BSCS, BSCE, BSBE', 'Synergis (\xa0www.synergishr.com\xa0) serves the needs of leading technology firms, carefully matching talent to full-time, contract or project positions. Exercises judgement in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results.   Champion best practices for high availability, scalability and reliability of data processing components ', 'Experience with Full Stack development and building services on the data stack', 'Build real time streaming pipelines that deliver data with measurable quality under the SLA', 'Experience with large-scale distributed systems as pertains to data storage and computing.', 'Highly proficient in Object Oriented Design and Development', 'Contributing towards building a system with a test-driven development / agile approach', 'Experience building micro services on Kubernetes a plusExperience working in the Advertising domain a big plus', 'Requirements:', 'Design and develop scalable data stores and frameworks with sub-second query latency on highly multi-dimensional data.', 'Not-Required but Preferred:', 'Experience working in the Advertising domain a big plus', 'Delivering products with top notch quality in a fast-paced environment', 'Position Summary', 'Responsibilities', 'Engineering solutions to aggregate and automate large scale data flows from varying sources', ' Works on complex issues where analyzing situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variables. ['', 'Hadoop/Solr/Spark/Angular', 'Full Stack Software Engineer', 'Java/C++/Python/Scala/JavaScript', 'The Software Engineer will be responsible for developing high-quality applications. They will also be responsible for designing and implementing testable and scalable code for the connected vehicle analytics platform. The Software Engineer will focus on delivering software leveraging Java, Python, Angular, Hadoop, Spark, Solr, Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF) etc. based on proven Lean/Agile methods. The Software Engineer will work in a small, cross-functional, and co-located team. The Software Engineer will collaborate directly and continuously with business partners, product managers and designers, and will release early and often.', 'Required: B.S. Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent work experience in the requested field', 'Education:', 'Experience Required: ']

job_title: Scientific Data Engineer – Data Analytics and Curation
job_text: ['', 'Required Qualifications', ' Experience building and optimizing ETL workflows. ', ' Possible inference and search prototype to validate ontologies. ', ' Monitor ongoing data quality and analysis results, working with data generation teams to process and analyze the data. ', ' Occasional exposure to laboratory atmosphere - possible exposure to chemical, biological or other hazardous substances. ', ' Perform basic quality control of data including tests for data integrity after ETL; test usability of the data during product prototyping ', '  Contribute to onboarding of consortium data managers to ensure data quality.   Design/prototype integration of external data sources and annotations into product.   Develop and maintain scripts for automatic updates from external ontologies and databases, and ETL to ingest format.   Codevelop requirements for ingest of feature integration and collaborate with compute pipelines for integration; prototype integration of derived data features into the data model for search, analysis and inferencing.   Develop documentation for data workflows, software and processes.   Support integration of spatial features derived from mapping of data to common coordinate frameworks.   Possible inference and search prototype to validate ontologies.   Monitor ongoing data quality and analysis results, working with data generation teams to process and analyze the data.   Co-develop requirements for tools to support data ingest, ETL and dashboarding.   Identify, design, and implement process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, providing feedback for re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability.   Support infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.   Perform basic quality control of data including tests for data integrity after ETL; test usability of the data during product prototyping  ', ' Design/prototype integration of external data sources and annotations into product. ', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' Familiarity with entire software toolchain, including source code management (git), debuggers, build tools, and testing methodologies. ', '  Sitting, standing, bending, squatting as found in typical office environment.   Occasional exposure to laboratory atmosphere - possible exposure to chemical, biological or other hazardous substances.  ', ' Develop and maintain scripts for automatic updates from external ontologies and databases, and ETL to ingest format. ', ' Develop documentation for data workflows, software and processes. ', ' Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and graph databases. ', ' Sitting, standing, bending, squatting as found in typical office environment. ', '  Experience with biological datasets.   Experience writing code for continuous delivery.   Advanced degree in a relevant technical discipline.   History of contributing to open source and/or team-based projects.  ', ' History of contributing to open source and/or team-based projects. ', ' Support integration of spatial features derived from mapping of data to common coordinate frameworks. ', 'Scientific Data Engineer – Data Analytics and Curation ', ' Experience with command line development tools in a Linux environment. ', ' Apply a modern software engineering workflow, including emphasis on code review, continuous integration, and automatic testing. ', ' Bachelor’s degree. ', ' Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience. ', ' Experience writing code for continuous delivery. ', '  Collaborate effectively with experts in diverse scientific and engineering topics, including neuroscience, high performance scientific computing, computer vision, and web applications   Apply a modern software engineering workflow, including emphasis on code review, continuous integration, and automatic testing.  ', ' Support infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. ', 'Work Environment', ' Experience with biological datasets. ', ' Advanced degree in a relevant technical discipline. ', ' Experience writing code and configuring systems to facilitate automated testing, building, and deployment of software. ', ' Contribute to onboarding of consortium data managers to ensure data quality. ', ' Extensive experience in scientific computing software in Python and/or Scala. ', ' Codevelop requirements for ingest of feature integration and collaborate with compute pipelines for integration; prototype integration of derived data features into the data model for search, analysis and inferencing. ', ' Identify, design, and implement process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, providing feedback for re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability. ', '  Bachelor’s degree.   Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.   Experience building and optimizing ETL workflows.   Strong project management, communication and organizational skills .   Experience with command line development tools in a Linux environment.   Extensive experience in scientific computing software in Python and/or Scala.   Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and graph databases.   Demonstrated experience in data analysis, preferably in signal processing and numerical methods.   Familiarity with entire software toolchain, including source code management (git), debuggers, build tools, and testing methodologies.   Experience writing code and configuring systems to facilitate automated testing, building, and deployment of software.   Ability to gather requirements from collaborators, synthesize into development work items, describe to colleagues and discuss implementation ideas, record issues, execute and complete.  ', ' Ability to gather requirements from collaborators, synthesize into development work items, describe to colleagues and discuss implementation ideas, record issues, execute and complete. ', ' Demonstrated experience in data analysis, preferably in signal processing and numerical methods. ', 'Essential Duties And Responsibilities', ' Strong project management, communication and organizational skills . ', ' Co-develop requirements for tools to support data ingest, ETL and dashboarding. ', ' Collaborate effectively with experts in diverse scientific and engineering topics, including neuroscience, high performance scientific computing, computer vision, and web applications ']

Role can only be performed in our Knoxville, TN Data Center  ', 'Minimum 5 years of experience in data center facility management and IS equipment installations.', 'Data Center Professional, BICSI, CDCD or similar certification', 'Design and implementation of redundant infrastructure for power, cooling, cabling, etc.', 'Expands knowledge of industry expertise in Data Center facility infrastructure and IS equipment.', 'Contributes positive support for team performance to metrics and service level agreements.', 'Tracks and support Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) tools to prioritize floor space, power and HVAC to ensure capacities are proactively and efficiently conducted.', 'Maintain effective communications with vendors, Infrastructure Support teams, and other USC departments collaborating with the Data Center.', 'Continuous improvement of efficiency using PUE or other metrics to assure system availability and effective power management.', 'Additional Notes', 'Experience troubleshooting outages, working with support teams and vendors to quickly and successfully restore service.', 'Support of infrastructure monitoring and alerting for power and cooling', 'Solid understanding of UNIX, Windows, and Network environments. Ability to configure basic IS systems', 'Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills', 'Strong competency, technical capability and initiative regarding IT industry hardware, virtual environments and storage systems.', 'Role can only be performed in our Knoxville, TN Data Center ', 'Coordinates and maintains Data Center equipment inventory and tools, utilizing the inventory process and managing and auditing the inventory to ensure accuracy.', ' Bachelor’s degree in a related field and computer electronics experience or equivalent combination of technical and functional experience required. Minimum 5 years of experience in data center facility management and IS equipment installations. Data Center Professional, BICSI, CDCD or similar certification Solid understanding of UNIX, Windows, and Network environments. Ability to configure basic IS systems Must have experience of Electrical and HVAC systems especially as related to data center environments. Must show strong competency, technical capability and initiative regarding cabling concepts, copper and fiber optics network connections and structured cabling. Strong competency, technical capability and initiative regarding IT industry hardware, virtual environments and storage systems. Prior project management experience preferred Excellent written and oral communications skills, including the ability to detail hardware configurations as installed. Knowledgeable of business continuity concepts, system duplications and industry standard methodology to assure system availability. Experience troubleshooting outages, working with support teams and vendors to quickly and successfully restore service. Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook Visio, BMC Remedy, and online research experience is vital for this role. Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills ', 'Coordinates successful completion of periodic preventative maintenance of data center equipment, cooling systems, UPS and battery, fire suppression, etc. in conjunction with Facilities teams.', 'Works with the Data Center Manager and leaders in developing strategic direction, design, and deployment for the Data Center facility infrastructure.', 'This is a 1st Shift role', 'Knowledgeable of business continuity concepts, system duplications and industry standard methodology to assure system availability.', 'Assists in resource planning including regularly attending planning and project meetings, updating projections, reporting metrics, scheduling, and prioritizing.', 'Bachelor’s degree in a related field and computer electronics experience or equivalent combination of technical and functional experience required.', 'Provides hands on support for IS and Engineering teams to fix and repair systems including electrical, network, phone, SAN, and console connections.', 'Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook Visio, BMC Remedy, and online research experience is vital for this role.', 'Supports tools and processes to assure project delivery for support teams and data center partners. Owns requests, workflow and communication of work.', 'Monitors and maintains a clean, safe, and efficiently operating Data Center facility (HVAC, UPS, PDU, and Fire Suppression).', 'Excellent written and oral communications skills, including the ability to detail hardware configurations as installed.', 'Implements and supports industry standard methodology design and standards to assure high availability', ' Works with the Data Center Manager and leaders in developing strategic direction, design, and deployment for the Data Center facility infrastructure. Implements and supports industry standard methodology design and standards to assure high availability Design and implementation of redundant infrastructure for power, cooling, cabling, etc. Support of infrastructure monitoring and alerting for power and cooling Continuous improvement of efficiency using PUE or other metrics to assure system availability and effective power management. Coordinates successful completion of periodic preventative maintenance of data center equipment, cooling systems, UPS and battery, fire suppression, etc. in conjunction with Facilities teams. Provides guidance for data center project work such as installation, moves, decommissions, cabling and power of Data Center equipment including servers and other hardware. Supports tools and processes to assure project delivery for support teams and data center partners. Owns requests, workflow and communication of work. Tracks and support Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) tools to prioritize floor space, power and HVAC to ensure capacities are proactively and efficiently conducted. Coordinates and maintains Data Center equipment inventory and tools, utilizing the inventory process and managing and auditing the inventory to ensure accuracy. Handles and coordinates shipping and receiving of packages and equipment for the Data Center. Monitors and maintains a clean, safe, and efficiently operating Data Center facility (HVAC, UPS, PDU, and Fire Suppression). Provides hands on support for IS and Engineering teams to fix and repair systems including electrical, network, phone, SAN, and console connections. Assists in resource planning including regularly attending planning and project meetings, updating projections, reporting metrics, scheduling, and prioritizing. Maintain effective communications with vendors, Infrastructure Support teams, and other USC departments collaborating with the Data Center. Contributes positive support for team performance to metrics and service level agreements. Expands knowledge of industry expertise in Data Center facility infrastructure and IS equipment. ', 'Essential Functions', 'Must have experience of Electrical and HVAC systems especially as related to data center environments.', 'Compensated on-call rotation for this position.', 'Handles and coordinates shipping and receiving of packages and equipment for the Data Center.', 'Prior project management experience preferred', 'Provides guidance for data center project work such as installation, moves, decommissions, cabling and power of Data Center equipment including servers and other hardware.', 'Required Experience', 'Must show strong competency, technical capability and initiative regarding cabling concepts, copper and fiber optics network connections and structured cabling.']

job_title: Manager of Data and Analytics (Remote or in our NYC, PHX or Waterloo locations)
job_text: ['', 'Generous and flexible PTO (we believe in our team having a great life outside of work)', 'An analytical thinker looking for an opportunity to own data projects from beginning to end, with a focus on driving better results for the business', ' A competitive base salary and a 401(k) with matching  Generous and flexible PTO (we believe in our team having a great life outside of work) Competitive parental leave policy Multiple health care options with premium plans  Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, & Commuter benefits  Weekly catered lunch, unlimited snacks, beer, cold brew on tap, etc. Team happy hours, events, and social clubs Free MakeSpace storage so you can take back your space ', 'Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, & Commuter benefits ', 'An expert in cloud data pipelines (Fivetran, Stitch, and other loaders), modern data lakes and warehouses (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.), visualization and business intelligence tools (Looker, Tableau, Mode, etc.), and data processing platforms (dbt, DataBricks, etc.). MakeSpace currently uses Fivetran, Stitch, Redshift, dbt, and Looker', ' An experienced individual contributor and "full-stack" analyst (a.k.a. analytics engineer), with 5+ years of experience in data science, data analysis, data engineering, or analytical/quantitative roles in management consulting, finance, marketing, or operations An analytical thinker looking for an opportunity to own data projects from beginning to end, with a focus on driving better results for the business An excellent communicator and a natural team player; curious and inquisitive and excited to gain deep knowledge of every functional area An aptitude for applying advanced analytics to solve business problems. Able to use modern data science/machine learning/AI/predictive analytics tools (Python/open-source preferred) to explore, prototype and ship analyses and internal tools. Very strong SQL required An expert in cloud data pipelines (Fivetran, Stitch, and other loaders), modern data lakes and warehouses (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.), visualization and business intelligence tools (Looker, Tableau, Mode, etc.), and data processing platforms (dbt, DataBricks, etc.). ['', 'Data Scientist – Machine Learning & Real-Time Decision Processing (Remote, US)', 'Building new products with applied AI and bring them to market.', 'Our ideal candidate will likely have…', 'Using online behavior data to determine the primary interest categories of consumers and the web properties they visit.', 'Deriving a set of new features that will help better understand the interplay between geography and audience features to improve model performance.', 'On any given day you’ll be…', 'Ability to grow and ultimately mentor team members of varying experience levels and competencies through data science, product and software development life cycles', 'Developing algorithms to optimize the setting of every lever in a high throughput real-time decision system.', 'Monitoring & improving a system that deploys and refits 10’s of thousands of models daily.', "WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?", 'An advanced degree in a relevant, quantitative field or equivalent experience working with Big Data and Spark in a professional setting', 'The professional experience and desire to perform responsibilities similar to those listed above', 'Participating in planning, roadmap, and architecture discussions to help evolve our AI processes to improve revenue-generating products.', ' Using geo location data to track foot traffic, commercial visitation and next most likely visit to understand consumer physical behavior. Using online behavior data to determine the primary interest categories of consumers and the web properties they visit. Implementing a predictive model to determine whether a person is likely to visit a car dealership based on the advertising signals they’ve received. Monitoring & improving a system that deploys and refits 10’s of thousands of models daily. Developing algorithms to optimize the setting of every lever in a high throughput real-time decision system. Analyzing data to better understand how a neighborhood’s consumption of web pages correlates with visits to a local big box store. Finding the handful of outliers in billions of transactions. Deriving a set of new features that will help better understand the interplay between geography and audience features to improve model performance. Building new products with applied AI and bring them to market. Participating in planning, roadmap, and architecture discussions to help evolve our AI processes to improve revenue-generating products. ', 'Implementing a predictive model to determine whether a person is likely to visit a car dealership based on the advertising signals they’ve received.', ' The professional experience and desire to perform responsibilities similar to those listed above An advanced degree in a relevant, quantitative field or equivalent experience working with Big Data and Spark in a professional setting Ability to grow and ultimately mentor team members of varying experience levels and competencies through data science, product and software development life cycles ', 'Finding the handful of outliers in billions of transactions.', 'Using geo location data to track foot traffic, commercial visitation and next most likely visit to understand consumer physical behavior.', 'Analyzing data to better understand how a neighborhood’s consumption of web pages correlates with visits to a local big box store.', 'Who We Are']

We strive to advance mission capabilities through the power of science.', '4.Experience programming at any level within the system hierarchy (physical, kernel, user)', '•Professional Development: Employees are encouraged to utilize resources to challenge and grow their skills', '1.Self-Management, Project Management, Benchmarking', '3.Constructing and designing software by writing robust code', '2.Continuous learning', 'We are looking for a Polyglot self-starter who can work independently but remain open to collaborating with other team members and members of other teams, both in terms of seeking help and providing help. Familiar with current distributed systems literature and the life cycle of the data infrastructure. Strong background in Python development with Linux. Good understanding of operations and building distributed systems at scale. Good understanding and experience of building data and machine learning systems. Excellent verbal and written skills. You collaborate effectively with other teams and communicate clearly about your work. Self-starter and someone who takes and drives initiatives. ', 'You Will Be Successful Here', 'Opportunity to make an impact across hardware and software.', 'Excellent verbal and written skills. ['Sr Big Data Engineer', '', 'PREFERRED SKILLS:', 'Collaborate with engineers and product to design solutions that deliver value while focusing on excellence in platform performance, scalability, extensibility, quality, and security', 'We are seeking an experienced big data engineer to join an exciting industry and product.\xa0This role will provide opportunities to directly influence architecture and\xa0technical strategies, and evolve best practices!\xa0\xa0', 'RESPONSIBILITIES:\xa0', '\xa0', 'Experience with S3, Kinesis, Databricks, PySpark and/or Snowflake', 'Be creative, humble, accountable, and collaborative', 'Leverage professional experience evolving ingestion, storage, resolution, warehousing, ETL, and similar big data disciplines\xa0\xa0', 'Solid understanding of big data tooling such as Spark, Hive, and big data databases', 'Strong proficiency in Python and SQL', 'Author clean, tested source code that supports architectural patterns and project goals\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'This is a 6 month contract to hire opportunity with full intention\xa0of converting into a full time role! The office is located in Cumming, Georgia. We are currently\xa0100% remote with no plans to return at this time. Normal operations are\xa03 days a week WFH before COVID (Tue/Thur are in-office).\xa0', 'Understanding of common ML models\xa0', 'REQUIRED SKILLS:', '2+ years experience as a Senior or Lead resource on a Big Data Engineering team', 'Contribute to conventions and patterns standards, assist in PRs to ensure compliance', 'RESPONSIBILITIES:', '7+ years experience engineering within Big Data technologies and large data sets2+ years experience as a Senior or Lead resource on a Big Data Engineering teamStrong proficiency in Python and SQLSolid understanding of big data tooling such as Spark, Hive, and big data databasesExperience with S3, Kinesis, Databricks, PySpark and/or Snowflake', 'Contribute with a spirit of continuous improvement\xa0', '7+ years experience engineering within Big Data technologies and large data sets', 'The ideal fit is someone experienced with python, spark, AWS, and multiple years working in data engineering environments.This role will contribute to several\xa0product features in addition to analysis, ETL, data pipelines, and data modeling. We have\xa0three primary tools that\xa0we interface with daily.\xa0To store all data in a centralized location, we use Amazon S3 as our Data Lake. From there we pipe that data into Snowflake DB, and from there we use Databricks (spark ecosystem) to do the\xa0ETL processing. Within Databricks we use Python as the primary language construct, but also SQL.', 'Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorships are not available.', 'Work within Kanban methodology']

Evolve the architecture of various components and services in the leaderboard system. Propose, experiment, and implement solutions to scale the leaderboard to hundreds of thousands of concurrent users. Achieve on-time delivery without compromising quality. ['', 'Here’s what you get:', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Design dimensional data models that satisfy data requirements and address ease of use and performance.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Work with users to mock-up dashboards and proof of concept data models.', 'The Data Warehouse Engineer gathers and interprets user analytics requirements, then transforms those requirements into dimensional data models. They collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and other data consumers within the business to gather and populate data warehouse table structures. The Data Warehouse Engineer implements dimensional models, from building the logical model to implementing the physical model and loading the data with ETL. The engineer makes big data easy through intuitive query writing, performance, and integrating BI tools. They run the full DW stack from design through implementation.', 'We are working on an exclusive retained search for a Data Warehouse Engineer for our client an industry leader experiencing hyper-growth headquartered in Boise, ID.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Charitable contributions and activities that make you feel like a better person', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Extract use cases and requirements from data warehouse users.', "Here's what you’ll be doing:", '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0WORK/LIFE Balance', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Regular team meetings and one-on-ones with your manager to make sure you are heard, and you are on track Career development and lots of internal promotion – this group is growing!', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Deep experience with database optimizer paths and data warehouse performance features.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0BEER30s/Snacks -once COVID passes', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0You will enjoy working with some of the smartest engineers in Boise', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0GREAT benefits', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Fun, collaborative work environment', 'Here’s what you bring to the table:', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Design and build out monitoring and support elements to ensure data quality and timeliness.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Minimum of three years of experience implementing dimensional data models (star schemas).', 'Data Warehouse Engineer ', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0yearly bonuses', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Tuition reimbursement', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience with building data warehouses on cloud infrastructure preferred.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Instantiate the dimensional data models on the Snowflake cloud platform.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Working on the latest and coolest technologies', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Matching 401k contributions', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience dimensional data modeling for data warehousing using star schemas or Snowflake schemas.']

['MTD is looking for a talented software engineer to develop commercial power equipment product for autonomous operations.\xa0The ideal candidate will apply his or her full-stack robotics software experiences toward algorithm design, motion control, sensor fusion, database, IoT and cloud computing.', '• Computer vision, machine learning and data analysis.', '• 3+ years’ experience of programing experience in Linux development environment, C/C++, scripting languages (python/bash), java, gcc/g++, make build tools, git, and database.', '• Use cloud computing, database tools, and IoT technologies to support the full product lifecycle, including product manufacturing and service.\xa0', '• Collaborate with a cross functional team of engineers in the development of the software and electrical systems for outdoor power equipment.', '• Knowledge of autonomy-related algorithms for mobile robotics such as path planning, SLAM, motion control, sensor fusion, collision detection and avoidance.\xa0', '• M.S./PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.\xa0MTD will consider applicants with B.S. and an equivalent level of work experience.', '• Generate engineering requirements and design documents; author and execute test. plans/processes for software verification and validation; document and present results.', '• Familiarity with a Data Distribution Service such as the Robot Operating System (ROS) software framework.', '\xa0', 'The candidate must have:', '• Strong skills in modular design and coding.', 'Founded in 1932 and headquartered in Valley City, Ohio, MTD is a global company known for innovation and award-winning lawn mowers, snow blowers and other equipment for both residential and professional markets. Our family of brands includes Cub Cadet®, Troy-Bilt®, Robomow®, Rover®, and WOLF-Garten® – all backed by our strong network of MTD support focused on uncompromising quality, service and value through advanced manufacturing.', '• Embedded systems, RTOS, communication protocols (ex. CAN, RS232, SPI).', 'MTD is an equal opportunity employer M/F/D/V.', 'Travel', 'Essential Functions:', '• Understanding of software lifecycle, coding standards, and git-based software version control.', 'Location:\xa0', '• Agile software development, gitflow workflow, test-driven development process.', '• Knowledge of functional safety standards (ex. IEC-61508).', 'Travel: The position requires some travel (10%), primarily domestically with some international travel.', 'MTD offers a competitive salary and benefit package that includes 401k, Defined Contribution Plan, Health and Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, paid vacation, and paid holidays.', '• Able to lift (up to 40lb), reach, bend otherwise work on and around outdoor power equipment such as lawn tractors, snow throwers and handheld power tools.\xa0', 'Work Environment:\xa0', '• Willing to work on outdoor power equipment in outdoor environment when needed.\xa0\xa0', '• Design and develop robotics software, diagnostic tools, and automated testing software for autonomous mowers.', '• Excellent time and project management skills including task estimation and project planning.', 'Job Summary:', 'Work Environment:', 'Indianapolis, IN', 'The ideal candidate will have experience with a subset of the following:', 'At MTD Products, we do more than just design, manufacture, market, and sell outdoor power equipment. We are an industry leader driven by a greater purpose to inspire people to care for and enjoy the outdoors. As employees, we foster collaboration and teamwork, drive for results, champion change, and inspire and motivate others to high performance. We value stewardship, passion, respect, integrity, and gratitude. And, every day we build upon the strong corporate culture that makes MTD a great place to build a career.\xa0']

You will work on multiple projects identifying and resolving complex security issues.\xa0Projects involve deep security vulnerabilities that target the operating system level. This is an opportunity to deepen your operating system security knowledge with a recognized leader in the industry. You will learn SELinux and other security processes to harden complex systems. This position is based in our Columbia, Maryland*** office. The candidate will be a member of a strong technical team with a high degree of autonomy and significant responsibility.\xa0', 'Software testing experience', 'Experience with identification and specification of data attack, data disclosure, etc. associated with file formats and protocols', 'SOFTWARE ENGINEER ', 'C, C++, Java and Python software development experience', 'Foundational Requirements', 'Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Math']

['', 'Who You Are:', 'Analytical and scientifically rigorous.', 'What You Will Do:', '\xa0', 'Develop a scalable module to continuously monitor performance of CLEAR’s exponentially growing biometrics systems', 'Explore novel imaging technologies (2D/3D) for face image capture in order to foster the growth of our platform.\xa0Establish and maintain CLEAR-wide best practices in image capture and performance evaluation.Design and run experiments to evaluate the performance of new capture devices, control algorithms, biometric algorithms, and user workflows.Establish a model of sample utility to optimize face image capture across applications.\xa0Develop a scalable module to continuously monitor performance of CLEAR’s exponentially growing biometrics systems', 'Explore novel imaging technologies (2D/3D) for face image capture in order to foster the growth of our platform.\xa0', 'CLEAR is seeking a Research Software Engineer to join our team. Your work will directly contribute to advancements in the field of human-computer interaction. You will be responsible for measuring and helping drive data-driven improvement of biometric matching accuracy, evaluation of biometric sensors, sourcing and assembling test apparatus, developing experiments, collecting data, and data analysis. The ideal candidate should be comfortable with creative problem-solving in a late-stage startup environment. If you like tinkering, are curious by nature, and/or consider yourself a technologist or an innovator, this may be the role for you.\xa0', 'Establish and maintain CLEAR-wide best practices in image capture and performance evaluation.', 'CLEAR’s mission is to strengthen security and create frictionless experiences. We believe you are you and by using your biometrics – your eyes, face, and fingerprints – we keep you moving.\xa0Imagine a world where you can do virtually everything you need to – breeze through the airport, buy a beer at the game, check-in at the doctor’s office, access your office building, and more – without ever pulling out your wallet. CLEAR is currently available in 50+ airports, stadiums and venues nationwide. Now with Health Pass, CLEAR securely connects a person’s digital identity to multiple layers of COVID-related insights to help reduce public health risk and restore peace of mind.', 'Must also possess software engineering experience & familiarity with one of the following technologies: Java, Python, C++, C#', 'Background in statistics, machine learning, computer vision, biometrics, robotics and/or imaging and have completed a software project in at least one of these areas.\xa0Must also possess software engineering experience & familiarity with one of the following technologies: Java, Python, C++, C#Must be experienced in at at least one field: R&D in computer vision, R&D in image processing, statistical modeling & analysisExperience in machine learning & computer vision packages such as openCV, etc. is desirable\xa0\xa0Ability to break down scientific results to product security and usability aspects.Analytical and scientifically rigorous.', 'We’re defining and leading an entirely new industry, obsessing over our customers, and investing in great people to lead the way. Recently named on CNBC’s Disruptor 50 List for the second year in a row and winner of the SXSW Interactive Innovation Award, CLEAR is providing innovative technology options for businesses and our 5+ million members to help create a safer environment no matter where you go.', 'Experience in machine learning & computer vision packages such as openCV, etc. is desirable\xa0\xa0', 'Must be experienced in at at least one field: R&D in computer vision, R&D in image processing, statistical modeling & analysis', 'Background in statistics, machine learning, computer vision, biometrics, robotics and/or imaging and have completed a software project in at least one of these areas.\xa0', 'Establish a model of sample utility to optimize face image capture across applications.\xa0', 'Ability to break down scientific results to product security and usability aspects.', 'Design and run experiments to evaluate the performance of new capture devices, control algorithms, biometric algorithms, and user workflows.']

job_text: ['', 'Store Technology: Serve approx. 130,000 colleagues in our stores with cloud-enabled, web-driven sales and productivity tools.', 'Program Benefits', 'This job overview is not all inclusive. Understanding of mobile interface guidelines ', ' Write automated integration and functional tests for native mobile application ', ' Career GrowthAt Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.SummaryTesting medical device application requires rigor and attention to detail to meet industry and regulatory standards. It takes someone who can solve problems, is unwilling to give up, and is in tune with the highly regulated nature of medical device software. We’re looking for a top-notch Mobile application test engineer with a focus on quality who has experience with iOS mobile testing. Having some web testing experience would be an added advantage.Responsibilities  Development of test scenarios following design and requirement documents to ensure intended behavior is verified   Write automated integration and functional tests for native mobile application   Interact with developers, business analysts, and other QA team members to identify, report, and troubleshoot defects in a detailed, efficient, and timely manner   Maintain, report test results and investigate test failures   Participate in code reviews with peers   Work in a highly regulated software environment   Focus on patient safety  Required Skills  Bachelor’s degree or higher in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science   3 or more years of test automation experience with at least 2 or more in the iOS platform   Knowledge of mobile hardware and software platforms   Hands-on experience with at least one of the following automation frameworks  XCUITest   Appium     Desire to learn, explore and push team practices to modern standards   Experience with Git and code reviews through tools like GitHub or GitLab   Work within Continuous Integration environments   Team player willing to collaborate with peers   Effective communicator and writer   Independent contributor who requires less or little supervision  Preferred Skills  Experience automating with Swift, Xcode   Understanding of mobile interface guidelines   Exposure of mobile cloud farms   Experience with mobile apps that communicate with external accessories   Experience working with the LATITUDE Clarity TM Data Management System and myLUX TM applications  About UsAs a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen.Boston Scientific is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Disability, VeteranBoston Scientific maintains a drug-free workplace. ['', 'Work closely with product and design to brainstorm effective ways to engage with CircleCI’s users.', 'About the Team', 'Hypothesize, plan, architect, implement, analyze, A/B test, and rapidly iterate on features and experiments that will get more users interested in our product.', 'You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed.\xa0', 'and', 'all', 'As part of this role, you’ll participate in our team’s on-call support rotation.', 'You bring a growth engineering mindset: You’re excited about hypothesizing, running experiments, and analysing data to evaluate success. You’re interested in getting invested in your approach to your work (growth engineering) over getting deeply into a specific domain. Prior growth engineering experience is not required.\xa0You have a high tolerance for ambiguity.You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.You’re excited about ensuring that\xa0all\xa0of our systems--software\xa0and\xa0human--scale smoothly.You value making decisions based on data and are open to being wrong and having your mind changed.\xa0', 'You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable, with an eye towards building in observability from the start.', 'We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.', 'How to apply\xa0', 'CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.\xa0', "What we're looking for:", 'CircleCI is looking for an engineer who cares deeply about users and their experiences with our product and is excited about running experiments with their team. As a senior member of our Engagement team, you will work closely with product, design, and your engineering teammates to build, test, experiment, analyze, and rapidly iterate on the features that have the most impact on the experiences of CircleCI’s users.\xa0', 'The Engagement team is our newest growth engineering team at CircleCI. Our team’s mission is to focus on promoting the value of our platform as simply as possible and aiding organizations to success. We hypothesize, build, analyze, and iterate on how people access our product, their onboarding experience, and their first four weeks with us. We’re a unique team in that we have the opportunity to work throughout the entire CircleCI web application - across marketing sites, onboarding, and through to our core CI/CD workflows - to help empower our users to deliver better software, faster.\xa0\xa0', 'The ability to build applications and services - primarily those with user interfaces - using well-accepted design patterns to allow for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling.\xa0', 'You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.', 'You have a high tolerance for ambiguity.', 'Collaborate with, lead, and mentor your engineering teammates through planning, pairing, testing, and delivery of the features you build.', 'What you’ll do in this role:\xa0', 'About CircleCI', 'CircleCI is a distributed team with Engineerings across the United States, Canada, Ireland, Germany, Japan and the UK. For this role, we are hiring engineers to work remotely anywhere in the United States, or in Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, New Brunswick,\xa0Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, Ontario, Prince Edward Island and Saskatchewan, through our affiliate Continuous Labs.', 'The ability to articulate opinions about user interface and user experience design and an understanding of how your work impacts our users.\xa0', 'You have experience writing, deploying, and operating high quality, well-tested, observable front-end code with some experience across the entire technology stack (we use React, GraphQL and Clojure, but it’s ok if you have not used them yet).', 'You’re excited about ensuring that\xa0all\xa0of our systems--software\xa0and\xa0human--scale smoothly.', 'You bring a growth engineering mindset: You’re excited about hypothesizing, running experiments, and analysing data to evaluate success. You’re interested in getting invested in your approach to your work (growth engineering) over getting deeply into a specific domain. Prior growth engineering experience is not required.\xa0', 'Working remotely at CircleCI', 'Please click the link to submit your resume directly to us!', 'You value making decisions based on data and are open to being wrong and having your mind changed.\xa0', 'Help implement the platform and processes for all future growth engineering efforts at CircleCI.', 'You have experience in the day-to-day practices of continuous delivery and agile development in a production environment.', 'Hypothesize, plan, architect, implement, analyze, A/B test, and rapidly iterate on features and experiments that will get more users interested in our product.Work closely with product and design to brainstorm effective ways to engage with CircleCI’s users.Help implement the platform and processes for all future growth engineering efforts at CircleCI.Collaborate with, lead, and mentor your engineering teammates through planning, pairing, testing, and delivery of the features you build.As part of this role, you’ll participate in our team’s on-call support rotation.', 'We’re looking for someone who enjoys collaboration, is curious and interested in learning, brings strong communication and teamwork skills, and helps others grow by sharing their expertise and encouraging best practices. If this sounds like you, here’s the additional experience we’re looking for:', 'The ability to build applications and services - primarily those with user interfaces - using well-accepted design patterns to allow for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling.\xa0You have experience writing, deploying, and operating high quality, well-tested, observable front-end code with some experience across the entire technology stack (we use React, GraphQL and Clojure, but it’s ok if you have not used them yet).The ability to articulate opinions about user interface and user experience design and an understanding of how your work impacts our users.\xa0You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable, with an eye towards building in observability from the start.You have experience in the day-to-day practices of continuous delivery and agile development in a production environment.You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed.\xa0', 'CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.', 'Bonus Points!']

['', 'Work closely with product managers to iterate on the vision for the platform', 'Work closely with product managers to iterate on the vision for the platformRapidly prototype both front end and back end solutionsAfter protoyping phase, lead a team of 3-5 frontend and backend engineers to create a marketplace solutionManage the code-base for the project, both contributing code and reviewingWork closely with product managers and operations to build quick iterations of solution', 'food goes to waste while millions of people go to bed hungry. The Farmlink Project is an', 'B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science or related field and 3+ years of previous work experience, or 7+ years of previous work experience and no degree necessary', 'Passion for the mission of The Farmlink Project', 'Knowledge of agile development or willingness to learn', "Minimum Qualifications (If you are passionate and talented we want to hear from you even if you don't have these exact qualifications): ", 'Rapidly prototype both front end and back end solutions', 'Manage the code-base for the project, both contributing code and reviewing', '1+ years of management experience', 'Knowledge of agile development or willingness to learnPassion for the mission of The Farmlink ProjectB.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science or related field and 3+ years of previous work experience, or 7+ years of previous work experience and no degree necessary1+ years of management experienceExperience in full stack development and front end development', 'Experience in full stack development and front end development', 'The FarmLink Project has made its impact to date via a completely people run process. From reaching out to farmers, to finding the perfect foodbank, and dealing with all the logistics and transportation in between, there are farmlinkers at every step. As we rapidly grow, even our hundreds of volunteers can’t keep up with the demand we are facing. The development and product team is working to automate the logistics of this process. We are in the process of creating a marketplace solution which will ultimately enable us to serve exponentially more farmers and food banks in need.', 'Please email emily@farmlinkproject.org with your resume and cv to apply.', 'innovative non-profit rescuing from the billions of pounds of fresh produce that would otherwise go to waste in order to feed people in need, reduce carbon emissions, and heal the planet. The grassroots movement began at the onset of the pandemic after seeing that food banks were facing an unprecedented increase in demand and millions of pounds of produce were being dumped or wasted as commercial farms around the country struggled to adapt to decreased and cancelled orders. Our team manages all of the logistics and operations involved in connecting fresh produce to food banks and communities in need. To date, we have delivered 9.5 million pounds of food, worked in over 35 states, and raised 1.79 million dollars. The Farmlink Project looks to develop a sustainable solution that will help us scale further and grow our impact.', 'Responsibilities: ', 'After protoyping phase, lead a team of 3-5 frontend and backend engineers to create a marketplace solution', 'We grow enough food to feed every person on Earth - yet, every year, 1/3rd of that', 'Work closely with product managers and operations to build quick iterations of solution']

Collaborate with other team members and other teams on all of the above. Implement, refine, and enforce software development techniques to ensure that delivered features meet software integration, performance, security, and maintainability expectations. Inspire a forward-thinking team of developers, acting as an agent of change and evangelist for a quality-first culture within the organization. ['', '4+ years of experience writing production-grade software in industry \xa0 ', 'An appetite for ongoing learning and growth and sharing knowledge with peers ', 'You will be contributing to our inclusive environment, fostering a culture that brings out the best in yourself and your colleagues. Your manager will be your champion and coach\u202fand will help ensure you are able to grow as an individual while you contribute to the excellence and advancement of our platform. ', 'We understand that the software we build has real-world consequences and take that responsibility seriously. ', 'Our Engineering values:\xa0 ', 'Collaborating with a product team to develop requirements and priorities, and communicating progress on execution and delivery. ', ' ', 'Advocating for best practices in the software engineering process, including documentation, reviews, and testing. ', 'High-level stack information: Go, Java, Python, Javascript (React, Next.js), PostgreSQL, NATS & AWS Testing stack information: Cucumber, Kotlin, Java, Selenium, Jenkins, Saucelabs More stack information: https://stackshare.io/companies/commonbond A team of passionate, curious, and innovative professionals ', 'Our Engineering values:', 'What you’ll be doing: ', '4+ years of experience writing production-grade software in industry \xa0 Experience with server-side web application development and mobile application development Demonstrated proficiency of technical tools / ecosystem, e.g. cloud platforms, database technologies, language-specific frameworks Understanding of agile processes and experience working in a self-organizing team Experience with automated testing and an advocate for the testing pyramid Excitement to write code that makes a difference An appetite for ongoing learning and growth and sharing knowledge with peers ', 'We know that code isn’t just a set of instructions for machines, but communication with other humans; style, elegance, and respect are important. ', 'Influencing our identity as a tech organization through involvement in guilds and by holding yourself and your peers accountable to our engineering principles.  ', 'What you’ll bring: ', "As an engineer with CommonBond, you'll be an essential contributor to the capabilities, performance, and security of our platform.\u202fWe build software that supports billions of dollars in education finance every year. In this role, we’ll rely on you to contribute to all aspects of our technology, including building microservices to support new features, creating new user experiences, and scripting for efficiencies in our back-office operations. It’s also an opportunity to influence the culture of our technology team and the processes that help us build world-class software. ", 'More stack information: https://stackshare.io/companies/commonbond ', 'Experience with server-side web application development and mobile application development ', 'High-level stack information: Go, Java, Python, Javascript (React, Next.js), PostgreSQL, NATS & AWS ', 'Our engineering and product organization is made up of ~20 people (and growing!). We’re organized into cross-functional teams of 3-6 people with clear areas of complementary focus. Teams operate independently in alignment with the broader organizational goals. ', 'Leading a team of engineers in breaking down large problems into technical execution plans. ', 'A team of passionate, curious, and innovative professionals ', 'Excitement to write code that makes a difference ', 'We believe that an ability to balance paying off technical debt and rapidly completing a project contributes to the health of the codebase, engineering team, and organization. ', 'Communicating delivered business value to stakeholders regularly. ', 'Understanding of agile processes and experience working in a self-organizing team ', 'Testing stack information: Cucumber, Kotlin, Java, Selenium, Jenkins, Saucelabs ', 'Experience with automated testing and an advocate for the testing pyramid ', 'We offer autonomy, responsibility, and a team of amazing in-office and remote colleagues, plus generous benefits including comprehensive healthcare, student loan reimbursement, a flexible time off policy, paid parental leave, volunteer time off and access to professional development instruments. ', 'We believe that ideas are more important than technologies. We understand that the software we build has real-world consequences and take that responsibility seriously. We know that code isn’t just a set of instructions for machines, but communication with other humans; style, elegance, and respect are important. We believe that an ability to balance paying off technical debt and rapidly completing a project contributes to the health of the codebase, engineering team, and organization.  ', 'What you’ll be working with: ', 'Developing, testing, and optimizing applications that serve our customers, partners, and internal users. ', 'We believe that ideas are more important than technologies. ', 'Developing, testing, and optimizing applications that serve our customers, partners, and internal users. Leading a team of engineers in breaking down large problems into technical execution plans. Collaborating with a product team to develop requirements and priorities, and communicating progress on execution and delivery. Advocating for best practices in the software engineering process, including documentation, reviews, and testing. Communicating delivered business value to stakeholders regularly. Influencing our identity as a tech organization through involvement in guilds and by holding yourself and your peers accountable to our engineering principles.  ', 'Demonstrated proficiency of technical tools / ecosystem, e.g. cloud platforms, database technologies, language-specific frameworks ', 'You can work in our New York City HQ; or remotely from anywhere in the US (EST working hours). Due to the on-going pandemic of COVID-19, if you choose to work from our NYC HQ, it is likely that you’ll start working remotely. ', 'We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.']

Improving the performance of existing software. Maintaining and upgrading existing software. Recommending new technologies that can help increase productivity.
